RelationshipElement.name: AboveBelow
RelationshipElement.description: Implehbments a above below for contexts.

RelationshipElement.name: ContextMatrix
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between contexts and matrices

RelationshipElement.name: ContextContextGroup
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a N:N between contexts and context groups

RelationshipElement.name: ContextArtefactGroup
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its artefact groups

RelationshipElement.name: ContextSample
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its samples

RelationshipElement.name: ContextSpecialFind
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its special finds

RelationshipElement.name: ContextDepositVolume
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its deposit volumes

RelationshipElement.name: ContextPhotographLog
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its photograph logs

RelationshipElement.name: SpecialFindSpecialFindLocation
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between special finds and their locations

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Context
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The physical result of any single action, whether it leaves a positive or negative record within the stratigraphic sequence. (MoLAS 1994)

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: AreaCode
property.description: Area or Trench: the working subdivision of an archaeological site.

property.name: Grid Location Reference
property.description: Reference number for the grid square(s) within which this Context falls.

property.name: Date Opened
property.description: Date on which the Context was first excavated.

property.name: Excavation Method
property.description: Method and conditions of archaeological excavation.

property.name: Highest Level
property.description: The highest elevation, or 'starting level', recorded for that context. This may be relative to the site grid, or real world co-ordinates, depending on the method of measurement.

property.name: Lowest Level
property.description: The lowest elevation recorded for that context. This may be relative to the site grid, or real world co-ordinates, depending on the method of measurement.

property.name: Target Spit Thickness
property.description: The minimum thickness of deposit

property.name: Minimum Context Thickness
property.description: The minimum thickness of the deposit base on the highest and lowest in each quadrant

property.name: Maximum Context Thickness
property.description: The maximum thickness of the deposit base on the highest and lowest in each quadrant

property.name: Context Comments
property.description: Additional comments on the description of the Context.

property.name: Artefacts Present
property.description: Whether or not artefacts where present in the {Context}

property.name: Soil Compaction Type
property.description: The type of compaction of sediments in the deposit, eg 'Compact', 'Cemented' or 'Loose'.

lookup.term: {aLoose} Can be excavated with hoe or trowel. (MoLAS 2004: 30)

property.name: Soil Munsell Colour
property.description: The Munsell Code for the soil colour.

property.name: Soil Colour
property.description: Simple description of the colour of the soil. This field is interpreted from the Soil Munsell Colour

property.name: Deposit Inclusions
property.description: Brief description of inclusions (eg stone flecks, artefacts).

property.name: Deposit Thickness and Extent
property.description: Brief description of the thickness and extent of the deposit.

property.name: Your Interpretation
property.description: Your Interpretation of the likely functional zone of the context, whether inside a structure, or part of the structure itself.

property.name: Your Discussion
property.description: Elaborate upon your basic interpretation.

property.name: Your description
property.description: Enter a simple descriptive interpretation. For example, is it a floor, midden, brickearth wall, gully or pit?

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Sketch

property.name: Photo
property.description: Photo

property.name: Distinguishing Marks
property.description: stinguishing marks on brick or stone.

property.name: Structure Description
property.description: Other description about structural elements, eg slate dry-proofing.

property.name: Excavators
property.description: The individual(s) involved in the excavation of the Context.

property.name: Checked by Square Supervisor
property.description: The date on which the record was checked by the Square Supervisor.

property.name: Checked by Director
property.description: The date on which the record was checked by the Square Supervisor.

property.name: LotID
property.description: A running 'lot' number that is a shorthand for Site-Area-Square-Context.

property.name: Highest Level NE
property.description: The highest elevation, or 'opening level', recorded for the NE quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Highest Level SE
property.description: The highest elevation, or 'opening level', recorded for the SE quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Highest Level SW
property.description: The highest elevation, or 'opening level', recorded for the SW quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Highest Level NW
property.description: The highest elevation, or 'opening level', recorded for the NW quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Highest Level Ctr
property.description: The highest elevation, or 'opening level', recorded for the centre of the Context.

property.name: Lowest Level NE
property.description: The lowest elevation, or 'closing level', recorded for the NE quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Lowest Level SE
property.description: The lowest elevation, or 'closing level', recorded for the SE quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Lowest Level SW
property.description: The lowest elevation, or 'closing level', recorded for the SW quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Lowest Level NW
property.description: The lowest elevation, or 'closing level', recorded for the NW quadrant of the Context.

property.name: Lowest Level Ctr
property.description: The lowest elevation, or 'closing level', recorded for the centre of the Context.

property.name: Deposit Volume
property.description: The volume of deposit removed from the Context, measured in litres.

property.name: Texture Percentage Sand
property.description: Percentage of sand in the deposit.

property.name: Texture Percentage Silt
property.description: Percentage of silt in the deposit.

property.name: Texture Percentage Clay
property.description: Percentage of clay in the deposit.

property.name: Soil Texture
property.description: Proportions of different grain sizes within the deposit, eg if there is more sand to silt it should be described as a 'silty sand'.

property.name: Soil Texture Actual
property.description: Proportions of different grain sizes within the deposit, eg if there is more sand to silt it should be described as a 'silty sand'.

lookup.term: No Observation No Observation. Use the Texture helper to prefil this.
{Sand} A sand has a loose gritty feel and does not stick together. Individual sand grains can be seen or felt. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Loamy_Sand} In a loamy sand particles barely stick together and a moulded piece of soil just holds its shape. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Medium_ribbon_(2.5-5cm_long)} The ribbon formed when a ball of soil is rubbed between thumb and forefinger is between 2.5 and 5cm long.
{Silty_Clay_Loam} A silty clay loam is like a clay loam but silty as well and smooth to the touch. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Clay_Loam} More easily moulded into a shape than a loam, a clay loam rolls out to a thin ribbon between the palms while a loam will break-up. When dry a clay loam will form a lump but is not as tough to break as a clay.(VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Sandy_Clay_Loam} A sandy clay loam is like a clay loam but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam) (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Strong_ribbon} The ribbon formed when a ball of soil is rubbed between thumb and forefinger is strong and over 5cm long.
{Silty_Clay} A silty clay is like a clay but smoother. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Clay} Clays are tough and can be moulded into shapes when moist. Clays form a long flexible ribbon when rubbed between the palms and the ribbon can often be bent into a U shape without breaking. Clays dry into very hard clods. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Sandy_Clay} A sandy clay is like a clay but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam). (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Weak_ribbon_(Less_than_2.5cm_long)} The ribbon formed when a ball of soil is rubbed between thumb and forefinger is less than 2.5cm long.

{Silt_Loam} A silty loam is like a loam but has a smooth silky feel when a moist sample is pushed between the index finger and thumb. On drying a sample can form a hard lump but this may be broken by hand. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Loam} A loam breaks into crumbs but will tend to stick together. Sand grains cannot be felt in a moist sample which when squeezed will retain its shape when handled freely. Loams are usually soft to the feel. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Sandy_Loam} A sandy loam sticks together more than a loamy sand but can be easily broken. Individual sand grains can be felt and heard if a wet sample is rubbed between the index finger and thumb and held close to the ear. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

property.name: Soil Moisture
property.description: The overall moisture content of the soil.

property.name: Wet Sieved
property.description: Was the deposit wet sieved?

property.name: Natural Formations
property.description: Geological formations evident in the deposit

property.name: Disturbances
property.description: Disturbances evident in the deposit

property.name: Bulk Sample Mapped
property.description: Has the bulk sample been mapped?

property.name: Trench Supervisor Review
property.description: Has the Trench Supervisor reviewed this {Context} record and confirmed data is complete and accurate?

property.name: Site Director Review
property.description: Has the Site Director reviewed this {Context} record and confirmed data is complete and accurate?

property.name: Date Closed
property.description: Date Closed

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation.

property.name: Area Code
property.description: Area or Trench: the working subdivision of an archaeological site.

property.name: Title
property.description: Name of the context group

property.name: Length
property.description: Length of the longest side, in mm.

property.name: Width
property.description: Width or diameter, in mm.

property.name: Depth
property.description: Depth or Height, in mm.

property.name: Component Type
property.description: Component Type

property.name: Component
property.description: Grains which comprise more than 10% deposit should be included here.

property.name: Percentage
property.description: Percentage

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Artefact Group
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The total group or assemblage of objects recovered from a single Context. These are sometimes referred to as 'Bulk Finds'.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Artefact Group ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the artefact group.

property.name: Artefact Class
property.description: Broad Artefact Class for each Artefact.

property.name: Artefact Quantity
property.description: The number of sherds in this group.

property.name: Artefact Weight
property.description: The total weight (in grams) of all sherds in this Group.

property.name: Artefact Group Comment
property.description: General comment about this group of Artefacts from this Context, eg 'Lots of early porcelain. Few marks.'

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Sketch

property.name: Photo
property.description: Photo

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Sample
ArchaeologicalElement.description: Deposit samples, or samples of building elements, recovered from this Context for the purpose of further analysis, or ongoing reference.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Sample ID
property.description: The unique code or reference for the Sample.

property.name: Sample Type
property.description: The type of Sample collected, eg Soil, Wood, Pollen.

property.name: Collection Method
property.description: Method of collecting the sample.

lookup.term:
{Hand_collection}
Hand sample of building elements, for example.

{Unsterilised}
A collection using standard excavation tools into a sterilised container.

property.name: Sample Weight
property.description: Weight (in grams) of the sample collected.

property.name: Sample Volume
property.description: Volume (in litres) of the sample collected.

property.name: Sample Comments
property.description: Additional comments about this sample, or its collection.

property.name: Structural Components
property.description: Primary components of structure or feature, eg dry-pressed brick, rough-hewn stone.

property.name: Bonding
property.description: Primary bonding material of structure or feature, eg mortar.

lookup.term:
{Unmortared}
No visible bonding material, ie unmortared

property.name: Bond Type
property.description: The type of bonding course, eg 'English bond'

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Sketch

property.name: Photo
property.description: Photo

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Special Find ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the special find.

property.name: Special Find Class
property.description: Broad Artefact Class for each Artefact (eg Glass, Ceramic, Building Material).

property.name: Special Find Name
property.description: Brief name or description for the Special Find, eg 'Wedgwood plate'.

property.name: X
property.description: The reading from the x-axis (horizontal) of an arbitrary site grid, corresponding to the location of the Special Find at the time of excavation.

property.name: Y
property.description: The reading from the y-axis (vertical) of an arbitrary site grid, corresponding to the location of the Special Find at the time of excavation.

property.name: Z
property.description: The elevation or depth of the Special Find at the time of excavation.

property.name: Special Find Description
property.description: Description of the Special Find.

property.name: Date From
property.description: The earliest known or likely date that this artefact may have been manufactured. Enter only a year. Use the certainty slide for approximate dates ie 'circa'.

property.name: Date To
property.description: The late known or likely date that this artefact may have been manufactured. Enter only a year. Use the certainty slide for approximate dates ie 'circa'.

property.name: Photo
property.description: Photo

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Deposit Volume
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The volume of a deposit measured in lots, usually by the bucket and following sieving.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Number of Buckets
property.description: Number of Buckets

property.name: Volume of Bucket
property.description: The volume in L of the deposit lot.

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Photograph Log
ArchaeologicalElement.description: A record of images created and stored on another device, eg by a professional site photographer.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context

property.name: Photograph Reference ID
property.description: Unique number or code allocated by creator of the image. It could be a filename or a reference number

property.name: Scene Type
property.description: The type of scene captured, eg opening or closing view of the Context. (Vocab: Open, Close, Other)

property.name: Latitude
property.description: Latitude of Special Find

property.name: Longitude
property.description: Longitude of Special Find

property.name: Northing
property.description: Northing of Special Find

property.name: Easting
property.description: Easting of Special Find
